definition: to go and live with one's wife's family, in effect becoming a member of her family
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
superfluous/redundant/cumbersome/refers to a son-in-law living with wife's family

sentences.english: He was adopted into the bride's family.

definition: lit. to work like an ox, to work like a horse; fig. to work extremely hard
the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zhu3 cheng2 shu2 fan4

definition: son-in-law (used by wife's family)/uncle (husband of father's sister)
pampered son of a wealthy family
(of parents) to bring up children for the purpose of being looked after in old age
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
to whisper to one another's ear
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
